Welcome

Welcome to ISTool help. This help is not complete, but hopefully it will be some day. For now I've only added topics for the most important features in ISTool, and the features that get most of the questions.

What is ISTool, and why was it created?

Jordan Russell has created a fantastic setup compiler that creates setups that can match most of the commercial installers on the market. This program is called Inno Setup, and is freeware for both commercial and private developers. If there is a disadvantage to Inno Setup, it would be that you will have to manually create the setup scripts. The format is fairly simple, but personally I have problems remembering all the options and parameters, and the meaning of them all. So that is why I decided to create ISTool, which displays all this information visually, and has context sensitive help for all parameters and options.

ISTool is not a complete package for creating installations. It is merely an addition to Inno Setup, and requires that Inno Setup is installed to function properly.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.html:
Frequently Asked Questions

When will ISTool support Inno Setup version x?

If the version of ISTool don't match the version of Inno Setup this doesn't mean that ISTool won't work with that version of Inno Setup. ISTool is designed to support any future version of Inno Setup, so if a particular version of Inno Setup has a feature that ISTool doesn't support directly you can still use that feature. Just add it to the script manually.

Sometimes Inno Setup is released without adding anything new that ISTool needs to support. It could be a bug fix, or some feature that has changed. In these cases I will not release a new version of ISTool.

item.title: Editing multiple items
item.html:
{keyword:editing multiple items;multiple items editing;items;tasks,Editing multiple items} {alink:task}

Editing multiple items

I get a lot of mail from people suggesting that ISTool should allow multiple files to be edited at once. This feature has actually been in ISTool since the very first version. To allow editing of several files at once, switch from treeview to listview by marking the Files As List menu item on the View menu, as shown in the picture. Then you can select as many files as you like by holding the ctrl or shift keys while selecting.

All listview sections in ISTool allow editing of multiple items at the same time, not just the file section.

item.title: Customize visible columns
item.html:
{keyword:columns;visible columns;customize columns;tasks,Customize visible columns} {alink:task}

Customize visible columns

All columns in the listviews can be customized. The columns can be rearranged by clicking the column header and dragging it where you want. You can also customize what columns should be visible. Open the customization dialog by selecting Customize from the View menu.

This will bring up this window. Check the columns you want displayed.

item.title: Translate ISTool
item.html:
{keyword:translate;Languages,Translate ISTool;transtool;tasks,Translate ISTool} {alink:task}

Translate

Method 1

  1. Copy one of the existing language files (*.lng).
  2. Translate it in any text editor.

Method 2

  1. Download TransTool.
  2. Copy the ISTool.idx to the ISTool directory if it is newer than your ISTool installation.
  3. Start TransTool.

Inno Setup Preprocessor

Inno Setup Preprocessor (ISPP) is an add-on for Inno Setup (IS) by Jordan Russell and My Inno Setup Extensions (ISX) by Martijn Laan. ISPP allows to conditionaly compile parts of scripts, use compile time variables in script, use built-in functions for reading registry, INI files at compile time.

Iwz2iss

iwz2iss converts InstallShield's IWZ project files into InnoSetup's ISS files.

item.title: Contact
Command Line
item.html:
{keyword:command line;commandline;compile}

Command Line Arguments

Usage: istool.exe [options] ScriptName

where options can be any of the following:

-compile

Instructs ISTool to compile the script and exit. Useful if you want to use a script to compile your script. This argument must be specified before the script file name.

-langedit

Used for helping translating menus and dialogs. Only useful for internal use.

Languages

This tab displays a list of languages you have defined in your script. If you select one or more languages here, the item will only be installed if one of your selected languages is chosen during installation.

If you don't select any languages the entry is always installed, unless other parameters say it shouldn't.
